title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-1.7 - Renewal of a provisional certificate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-1.7 - Renewal of a provisional certificate

State Regulations
(a) The holder of a provisional certificate in the pupil
personnel service whose certificate has expired may have such certificate
renewed on up to two occasions for a period of five years from the effective
date of the renewal. (1)

For the first
renewal, the candidate shall meet all requirements for the permanent
certificate in the certificate title of such provisional certificate except the
education and/or experience requirement. (2)

For the second renewal, the candidate
shall meet all requirements for the permanent certificate in the certificate
title of such provisional certificate except the education or experience
requirement. (b) The
requirements for the permanent certificate shall be those in effect at the time
the renewed provisional certificate is issued. (c) A candidate who holds an expired
provisional school administrator and supervisor certificate and applies and
qualifies for a renewal of such certificate prior to September 2, 2024 may have
such certificate renewed on one occasion only for a period of five years from
the effective date of the renewal, provided that the candidate has achieved a
satisfactory score on the school building leader assessment that is required
for a certificate as a school building leader. (d) Notwithstanding subdivisions (a) or (c)
of this section, candidates who were issued one renewal of a provisional
certificate and one time extension pursuant to section
80-1.6
(a) and (b)
of this Title shall not be eligible to receive a second renewal of such
provisional certificate. Candidates who were issued a time extension pursuant
to section
80-1.6
(a) and (b)
of this Title shall be eligible to receive only one renewal of such provisional
certificate under the first renewal requirements in paragraph (a)(1) of this
section. Candidates who were issued a renewal of a provisional certificate on
or after May 20, 2020 and prior to August 2, 2023 may receive a second renewal
under the first renewal requirements in paragraph (a)(1) of this
section. Notes
